titleStmt.title: W. I. Dallam et al. to Abraham Lincoln
CWG1181

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, 1863-1867

body.p:
Henderson Ky March 23rd 1864
His Excellency A Lincoln
President U.S.

James Rouse now a prisoner at Rock Island desires to take the oath contained in the proclamation of Dec 8th 1863 & return home -- Said Rouse enlisted on the day of 186 as a musician in the Regt (Rebel) Ky vols Before this Mr Rouse had been a good citizen and we have no doubt that if he is permitted to return that he will so conduct himself in future -- He formerly lived in this county & desires to return here -- He Enlisted in Union County -- He has numerous relatives in this county a majority of whom are loyal and considered as good citizens as we have -- We respectfuly petition for his release upon the usual conditions

W. I. Dallam
D. N. Walden, Sheriff, H, C
Ed L Starling Jr.
Chas T. Starling
Geo. M. Priest
W R Kenney
Saml W Langley
C W Hutchen,
E, D, McBride
W. S. Johnson
James B Lyne
D. B
John McBride P. M
Ira Delano
Jacob Held,
